channel.title: Nest | The Learning Thermostat
channel.description: Read the Nest blog to find out news about the Nest Learning Thermostat, how Nest is making the home smarter & how to use your thermostat to save energy.

item.title: Welcome to the Nest Community.
item.dc:creator: Matt Rogers
item.description:
We like you. We think you’re smart, funny and, frankly, have excellent taste in thermostats. But we’d like to get to know you better, so today we’re unveiling the Nest Community.

The Nest Community is a forum where you can talk to us and, more importantly, talk to each other. We hope you’ll make this community your own, whether you’re sharing installation stories, cool photos of…

item.title: Tom vonReichbauer & Shige Honjo join exec team.
item.dc:creator: Tony Fadell
item.description:
It’s people who make a company. And I’ve always been incredibly proud of the amazing people at Nest. Today we’re adding one more: Tom vonReichbauer is joining as CFO. We’ve also promoted long-time Nester Shige Honjo to the Nest executive team.

Tom comes to Nest from Tesla Motors. He joined Tesla when it was a small startup, just beginning production of its first car. Through his…

item.title: Understanding the Nest Leaf.
item.dc:creator: Yoky Matsuoka
item.description:
The Nest Leaf was designed to be simple: quick feedback when you do something that saves energy. It’s there to guide you towards efficient temperatures and reward you when you get there.

But it’s also a bit of a game, and people have been asking about the rules. Everyone wants more Leafs, others simply want to know why they got a leaf today, but not yesterday.

So here’s…

item.title: Nest Gift Guide 2012.
item.dc:creator: Matt Rogers
item.description:
Our second annual holiday gift guide ranges from the reasonable to the sublime to the ridiculous. Once again, we’ve asked the makers of Nest—everyone here in our office—to share their wish lists. A fun game to play: guess which suggestions came from engineers? 




Sam’s a fan of Boosted Boards, which turn longboards into electric-powered vehicles. They’re not quite…

item.title: Meet your new Energy Report.
item.dc:creator: Yoky Matsuoka
item.description: We’ve completely redesigned our monthly Nest Energy Report—and we’re really excited. The Energy Report still gives you a summary of what Nest has been doing in the last month, but now it goes way beyond our original design and is available in multiple languages. When we sent the first Energy Report out back in May, we gave you the basics: how much energy you used, how many…

item.title: Nest available in stores across Canada.
item.dc:creator: Erik Charlton
item.description:
We’re excited to announce that the Nest Learning Thermostat is now available at some of our favorite retailers across Canada. Lowe’s, Home Depot and Amazon.ca are now carrying Nest just in time for winter. 

We know it gets cold up there, so we think you’ll enjoy comfort features like Early-On and True Radiant. And we know you don’t like to waste energy, so Auto-Schedule,…

item.title: Black Friday deals on Nest and more.
item.dc:creator: Erik Charlton
item.description:
The day after Thanksgiving is filled with furious shopping, tearing of coupons and high-speed deal grabbing. And starting Nov 23rd, one of the best deals to grab is at Lowe’s: the Nest Learning Thermostat 1st Generation will be $198 through Monday, Nov 26th. 

You can pick up your new Nest from your local Lowe’s or on Lowes.com on Black Friday. It makes a great addition to any…

item.title: Warming up to True Radiant.
item.dc:creator: Yoky Matsuoka
item.description: Underfloor radiant systems and radiators are pretty great. Instead of blowing hot air through vents, they use water or electric coils to heat up a room. They’re more energy efficient, quieter, maintain a comfortable humidity and keep the temperature stable. And underfloor radiant has revolutionized stepping out of the shower—a warm bathroom floor can change your whole…

item.title: Nest thermostat now at Best Buy.
item.dc:creator: Erik Charlton
item.description:
Starting today, the 2nd generation Nest Learning Thermostat is available in more than 600 Best Buys across the US and on bestbuy.com for $249. 

Many Best Buy stores will feature a live Nest thermostat for a hands-on experience—try changing the temperature, adjusting settings and turning the stainless steel ring before you buy.



It may seem strange for a thermostat to be…

item.title: Understanding Early-On
item.dc:creator: Yoky Matsuoka
item.description: The Nest Learning Thermostat’s new Early-On feature is simple: it’s like pre-heating your oven. Nest sees what temperatures are coming up on your schedule, knows how long it’ll take to reach them, and turns the heat or AC on early so you’ll be comfortable right on time. Easy. But things get much more interesting—for me, anyway—when you look at how Early-On does what it…

item.title: Today is Nest's first anniversary.
item.dc:creator: Tony Fadell
item.description: One year ago, we opened our doors to the world. We introduced our company, Nest Labs, and our first product, the Nest Learning Thermostat. It was a completely insane day—we crammed most of the company into a single conference room for 24 hours. Nobody slept, cheers echoed through the office at 4am, champagne was poured into coffee mugs and our eyes were locked to our…

item.title: Meet your Nest Certified Professional.
item.dc:creator: John Gilmore
item.description: We designed the Nest Learning thermostat to be easy to install, but some homeowners don’t have the time or experience to install a thermostat themselves, and some systems are too complicated for ordinary mortal men. That’s why we created Nest Certified Professional, our heating and cooling professional program. Nest Certified Professionals have been trained to install, set up and…

item.title: Next generation Nest in stores now.
item.dc:creator: Erik Charlton
item.description:
On October 2, we announced the next generation Nest Learning Thermostat and shipped Nest software 3.0. The 2nd generation Nest is now shipping from Lowes.com and Amazon.com, and is also beginning to appear on shelves in more than 1,700 Lowe’s stores nationwide.

If you’ve been wanting to get your hands on the new Nest and take a look at the slimmer design for yourself, it’s a good…

item.title: The next generation Nest thermostat.
item.dc:creator: Tony Fadell
item.description:
We always wanted to make the best thermostat in the world. And within minutes of launching the first Nest Learning Thermostat less than a year ago, the amazing reviews, requests and feedback came pouring in. We listened to what you said and saw what more we could do. We could make the best thermostat in the world better. 

Today we’re introducing a new Nest Learning Thermostat.…

item.title: Nest: Installation for ages 8 and up.
item.dc:creator: Matt Rogers
item.description:
Something adorable has been happening lately. Turns out Nest thermostat installation is so simple that a child (with proper adult supervision) can do it. And it may be the cutest thing we've ever seen. We don't want to alarm you, but “kids and thermostats” may be the new “kids and puppies.”

I once wrote a blog post where I talked about playing with…

item.title: The iPhone controlled home.
item.dc:creator: Erik Charlton
item.description:
This week we’re at the CEDIA (Custom Electronic Design and Installation Association) Expo in Indianapolis: a convention for home automation companies to showcase their next-generation lighting, security, entertainment and heating and cooling controls.

While we’re there to talk about Nest, we’re also walking around to see how other companies are working to create a more…

item.title: Nest thermostats for business.
item.dc:creator: Matt Rogers
item.description:
We talk a lot about home around here, but for many of us, the amount of time
we spend at home is dwarfed by how much of our lives we spend at work.
Luckily, the Nest Learning Thermostat works great there too.

In far, far too many offices, the instructions for the thermostat look
something like this:



And it could be worse: the thermostat in your office may not work at
all.

The…
